body.p:
Govner Bramlet your honer & Excelency: I William Walker have bin Tried & Convicted to the Penitentiarey for one year & it is my first ofence. So I can onley Recomend my self to your kind mercy to be pardoned. I am a member of the twentey fourth Ohio vols. & have bin true to my cuntrey's laws & have nobely discharg^ed^ my duty as a Soledier for the period of to years & allso I have a widoed Mother to mantain whom it greavs my heart with horer to part with noing that I am the only one in this world for her to depend on for assistance your honer I can state to you veary plainley the reason why I am in this Sad & disgrasfull State it is not because I natuerley posesed a felonious disposition. but becas I hav bin deprived of & Seperatid from thos kind
friends. That instenced me. & hav bin led astray. by inteligent men whouse influince & wickid temtations & vises & inticing habits have at length brought me to my ruin and I think providence that I hav bin detected in this my first offence and braught to acount for it at the hands of Justice how it greavs me when I think that onley twelve months ago I was aseid with honesty and piety & was blesed with the qualities of eney society & now to think that I am incarcerated in this contemtible prison & found guilty & convicted of a greavious & felonious Crime. Deprived of two years liberty and sentanced to a glumey sell. to dwell with the the veary demons of wickedness and outlaws of the world is this my dome, your honer I pray not!

William Walker
Co. B. 24th Reg. O. V

Jefferson County
Pardon Refused
Tho E Bramlette
